item.title: Germany: Forvia Hella teams up with Tau Motors on innovative onboard charger for EVs
item.description:
Forvia Hella has entered into a strategic development partnership with Tau Motors, a pioneer in software-defined power conversion, to create a “Virtually Isolated Onboard Charger” (viOBC) for electric vehicles, aiming for series production within two to three years. The transformerless design delivers over 98% charging efficiency, reduces weight and space needs, and enables advanced energy management, including bidirectional vehicle-to-grid integration. The partnership seeks to set new standards in onboard charging technology, supporting sustainable, smart mobility. Forvia Hella is strengthening its position as an innovation leader by way of contribution to sustainable mobility.

Link to original article (in German)

item.title: Germany: ZF CEO says Division E not competitive in some areas
item.description:
ZF Friedrichshafen CEO, Holger Klein, said the company has achieved EUR 5.8 billion in savings but has yet to meet its self-imposed cost-cutting goals, with an original target of EUR 6 billion set for 2024 to 2025. Klein stressed that more action is needed, particularly in the struggling driveline division, “Division E,” which covers transmissions for all drive types. The unit is grappling with delayed e-mobility demand, high costs, and low margins in conventional transmission products. Management and the works council are in talks over the division’s realignment as ZF works to restore competitiveness.

Link to original article (in German)

item.title: Malaysia: Zeekr to begin local assembly at Proton’s EV hub in Tanjong Malim
item.description:
Zeekr, Geely’s premium EV brand, will soon be locally assembled (CKD) at Proton’s new EV factory in Tanjong Malim’s Automotive High-Tech Valley (AHTV), according to launch press materials. While details remain scarce on whether Zeekr will build its own plant or use Proton’s facilities, the move strengthens Geely’s role in Malaysia, where it also holds a 49.9% stake in Proton. The announcement makes Zeekr the second major Chinese EV brand, after BYD, to establish a presence in Tanjong Malim.

Link to original article

item.title: Brazil: Car sales in country fall 3.6% in August 2025
item.description:
Brazil’s car market declined by 3.6% year-on-year in August 2025, with total sales reaching 215,000 units. Fiat led the market with 45,000 vehicles sold, securing a 21.1% share. Volkswagen rose to second place with 39,000 units sold, up 6.3% from last year. Chevrolet followed with 22,000 vehicles and a 10.2% market share, while Hyundai and Toyota sold 17,000 and 16,000 units respectively.

Link to original article (in Chinese)
item.source: EE Times China - 电子工程专辑

item.title: US: South Korea protests detention of Hyundai EV plant workers in Georgia
item.description:
South Korea has lodged a protest after US immigration authorities detained hundreds of workers at Hyundai’s electric vehicle battery plant construction site in Bryan County, Georgia. The facility, a joint venture between Hyundai Motor Group and LG Energy Solution, employs around 1,200 people. The US Homeland Security Investigations (HSI) agency, stated the raid was part of an investigation into unlawful employment practices and was conducted on 4th September, 2025.

Link to original article

item.title: Global: Audi embarks on transformation with portfolio renewal and new design identity
item.description:
Audi has entered a new transformation phase under CEO Gernot Dollner, focusing on portfolio renewal, organisational clarity, and a sharper design philosophy to strengthen its premium market position. As part of this direction, Audi has introduced a new design philosophy under Massimo Fraschella, focusing on simplified digital interactions, refined materials, and purposeful innovation. Having launched 20 new models in the past two years, spanning ICE, hybrids, EVs, and performance lines, Audi expects to hold the youngest portfolio in the premium sector by year-end. Balancing ICE and hybrid stability with EV growth, Audi aims to drive long-term innovation and sustainable expansion through what Dollner described as a once-in-a-generation transformation.

Link to original article

item.title: India: Volkswagen to introduce electric urban car range
item.description:
Volkswagen is evaluating opportunities to introduce its small, affordable electric cars in India, supported by favorable GST reductions. CEO Oliver Blume, described India as a “fantastic” and “fascinating” market, highlighting its growing automotive potential. At the IAA Mobility event, the company showcased models such as the ID. CROSS Concept SUV, Skoda Epiq SUV, Volkswagen ID. Polo, and CUPRA Raval, all part of its all-electric small car family. By collaborating with partners and focusing on affordability, Volkswagen aims to expand its presence and make sustainable mobility more accessible across its brands in India.

Link to original article

item.title: Latin America/Africa: Chinese automakers step up global expansion to overcome tariffs and boost exports
item.description:
China’s automotive industry is strengthening its global footprint by expanding into Africa and Latin America to bypass tariffs in Europe and the US. Morocco has emerged as a strategic hub, offering access to the Mediterranean and Atlantic, an established industrial base with players like Renault and Stellantis, and abundant cobalt resources. According to AlixPartners, Chinese automakers’ market share in Africa and the Middle East is projected to rise from 10% in 2024 to 34% by 2030. From January to May 2025, Chinese vehicle exports to Africa surged 67% year-on-year, reaching 222,000 units.

Link to original article (in Spanish)

item.title: Germany: Mercedes-Benz may fail to meet EU emission limits
item.description:
According to the Transport and Environment Organisation (T&E), Mercedes-Benz may fail to meet the EU emission limits. It is expected to exceed the limits by ten grams per km between 2025 and 2027. Other car manufacturers, like BMW, Renault, and Stellantis, will meet the emission targets. Volkswagen (VW) will meet the targets narrowly. Those who do not meet the limit at the end of the transition period may form a pool with better performing competitors.

Link to original article

item.title: UK: Zircotec develops multifunctional coatings to enable lightweight EV battery solutions
item.description:
Zircotec, a UK-based automotive technology company, has introduced multifunctional “ElectroHold” coatings as part of the CeraBEV project with Cranfield University. The advanced coatings integrate flameproofing, dielectric, and thermal properties, allowing electric vehicle manufacturers to replace heavy steel battery enclosures with lighter aluminium and plastic composites while ensuring safety and efficiency. The innovation also improves cooling plate performance by combining thin electrical insulation with enhanced thermal conductivity, supporting the shift toward lighter, more efficient EV designs.

Link to original article

item.title: Europe: OPmobility partners with HESS to supply batteries for electric buses
item.description:
OPmobility has partnered with Swiss bus manufacturer, HESS, to supply battery packs for several hundred electric buses, with initial deployments already in France, Switzerland, and Italy. Targeting large-capacity urban buses, the collaboration supports European cities’ efforts to reduce emissions and modernise public transport fleets amid growing demand for cleaner mobility solutions.

Link to original article (in French)

item.title: US/Sweden: Cadence to acquire Hexagon’s design & engineering unit for EUR 2.7 Billion
item.description:
Cadence Design System, a US chip design software provider, has entered a definitive agreement to purchase Hexagon AB’s Design & Engineering (D&E) division, including its MSC Software business, for EUR 2.7 billion. This acquisition significantly broadens Cadence’s portfolio in mechanical simulation, giving it access to new markets such as aerospace and automotive including customers like Volkswagen Group, BMW, and Lockheed Martin, which currently use Hexagon's D&E solutions.

Link to original article

item.title: China: Schaeffler begins mass production of high-voltage inverter brick in Tianjin
item.description:
Schaeffler has marked a key milestone in its electrification strategy by commencing volume production of its high-voltage inverter brick at its Tianjin facility in China. This marks the first large-scale production of the modular inverter subassembly, designed for a prominent Chinese automotive manufacturer. The product rollout was achieved within just one year, showcasing rapid development efficiency.

Link to original article

item.title: France: Valeo and Capgemini collaborate on Level 2+ autonomous vehicle development
item.description:
Valeo has partnered with Capgemini to test and validate a new advanced driver assistance system (ADAS) up to level 2+ autonomy. This solution combines a 360° suite of sensors integrating cameras and radars with software-defined functionalities. The new architecture will enter production in 2028. To ensure smooth operation in the complex vehicle environment, Valeo will rely on its unique know-how: the combination of state-of-the-art equipment, software expertise and recognized complex system integration capabilities. Capgemini will provide a comprehensive range of services, from system and software development to data-driven verification, validation and approval, to support this innovation. Together, the partnership represents a major step forward in intelligent mobility, working to accelerate both the safety and efficiency of advanced driver assistance and pave the way toward autonomous vehicle deployment.

Link to original article (in French)

item.title: Denmark: Castrol backs Zenvo’s Mahle engineered hybrid hypercar Aurora with innovative fluid solutions
item.description:
Danish hypercar manufacturer, Zenvo Automotive, has entered into a technical partnership with Castrol. The two companies will work together on the final stages of pre-production development for the Aurora, a revolutionary hybrid hypercar, which is developed in partnership with MAHLE Powertrain and paired with a triple electric motor system. Castrol will provide innovative fluid solutions, including gearbox oil, brake fluid, battery thermal management fluid, engine coolant and engine oil, to support ambitious performance goals for the new car.

Link to original article

item.title: Germany: Ensinger rolls out product-specific CO₂ footprints, boosting transparency and sustainable choice
item.description:
Ensinger GmbH is now providing Product Carbon Footprint (PCF) data on a per-kilogram basis for each of its semi-finished plastic products calculated using a cradle-to-gate approach in line with DIN EN ISO 14040ff and IPCC GWP 100a standards. This initiative, developed with the EPSM (Engineering Polymer Shapes for Machining Association) allows for comparable values ​​across manufacturers.

Link to original article (in German)

item.title: Global: Valeo and Momenta form strategic alliance to co-develop ADAS and autonomous driving solutions
item.description:
Valeo and China-based autonomous driving innovator Momenta have formalised a long-term, global partnership to jointly develop sophisticated mid- to high-level intelligent assisted driving and autonomous driving systems. This collaboration spans both China and international markets, and brings together Valeo’s expertise in computing platforms and sensors with Momenta’s advanced AI and software capabilities. The partnership is designed to support the full product lifecycle from market exploration and system integration to continuous software upgrades helping automakers accelerate deployment of intelligent mobility technologies. The companies are already in discussions with several OEMs regarding future joint projects.

Link to original article

item.title: Global: Volvo Cars’ August sales decline 9% amid drop in electrified vehicle demand
item.description:
Volvo Cars reported a 9% drop in global sales for August 2025, totaling 48,029 vehicles. Sales of electrified models, including fully electric and plug-in hybrids, fell 17% year-on-year, accounting for 43% of the month’s total. Fully electric vehicles made up 20% of sales, while plug-in hybrids represented 23%, reflecting weakening demand in the electrified segment.

Link to original article

item.title: US: Light vehicle sales up 7.3% in August 2025 on a selling day-adjusted basis
item.description:
US Light Vehicle (LV) sales in August 2025, rose 7.3% year-on-year on a selling day-adjusted basis. According to preliminary figures, at a brand level, Toyota lead the market, with 192,000 units sold. It was followed by Ford and Chevrolet, with 177,000 and 164,000 vehicles sold, respectively. In terms of OEM sales, GM lead with 252,000 units sold and a market share of 17.1%, followed by Toyota Group, Ford Group and Hyundai Group.

Link to original article

item.title: UK: Horse Powertrain develops solutions to convert BEVs into REEVs
item.description:
Horse Powertrain has developed a range of modular and compact solutions that can transform battery electric vehicles (BEVs) into hybrid or LPG systems without disrupting the starting platform. The HORSE C15 is a 'pocket' module that integrates a 1.5L four-cylinder engine, generator, inverter, and cooling system into a single 500×550×275mm block. Designed to be installed in the front and rear compartments of BEVs, this module allows an electric vehicle to be quickly converted into a range-extended electric vehicle (REEV) with minimal modifications. Full-scale production of the Future Hybrid Concept is planned for 2028.

Link to original article (in French)

item.title: UK: Everrati and Raeon electrify GT40 with advanced battery featuring thermal management
item.description:
Everrati Automotive, the British technology leader in redefining iconic cars has partnered with bespoke battery development and manufacturing specialist, Raeon, to develop an advanced battery system for its redefined GT40 vehicle, combining zero-emission performance with the car’s iconic driving dynamics. Raeon’s patent-pending “Any Shape” battery technology allows faster, more cost-effective development, optimises energy storage, and incorporates advanced thermal management for high-performance charging and discharge.

Link to original article

item.title: Australia/China: Chinese automakers surge in country as four brands enter top ten
item.description:
China is reshaping the Australian car market, with BYD, GWM, MG, and Chery entering the top ten brands for the first time. According to the latest FCAI sales figures, 20,070 Chinese-made vehicles were sold in August 2025, a 67% increase from August 2024, accounting for 20% of all new vehicle sales that month. The rise of these four brands highlights the shifting dynamics of Australia’s automotive landscape.

Link to original article

item.title: China: AITO surpasses 750,000 deliveries, sets benchmark in luxury NEV market
item.description:
AITO has surpassed 750,000 total deliveries as of August 2025, setting a new benchmark among China’s luxury new energy vehicle brands. The achievement is attributed to improvements across its entire value chain.

Link to original article

item.title: Norway: Tesla leads country's car market with 22% sales growth in August 2025
item.description:
Tesla strengthened its position as Norway’s top-selling car brand in August 2025, with sales rising nearly 22% year-on-year. According to the Norwegian Road Federation, battery electric vehicles dominated the market, accounting for 97% of all new car registrations during the month.

Link to original article

item.title: China: Tesla partners with Kangfu Leasing to launch energy project in Shanghai
item.description:
Tesla has teamed up with China Kangfu International Leasing Co. and the Shanghai government to launch the world’s largest energy project, valued at USD 557 million. The initiative, powered by Tesla’s advanced lithium-ion batteries, will support China’s renewable-heavy power grid by ensuring a stable energy supply and addressing intermittency issues from wind and solar sources. Positioned as a critical step in strengthening China’s clean power infrastructure, the facility enhances Tesla’s influence in the global energy market while providing reliable, software-driven solutions for urban power needs.

Link to original article

item.title: US: GM and LG Chem form strategic partnership to boost EV battery production in North America
item.description:
General Motors has partnered with LG Chem to expand EV battery production in North America, addressing rising demand and regulatory pressures driving electrification. The joint venture will establish advanced manufacturing facilities and focus on developing next-generation battery technologies with higher energy density, faster charging, and longer lifespans. Alongside innovation, both companies are committed to sustainability through responsible material sourcing and battery recycling, strengthening their position in the competitive electric vehicle market.

Link to original article

item.title: Europe: Volkswagen expands partnership with Northvolt to boost battery production
item.description:
Volkswagen and Northvolt have announced an expanded partnership to increase battery production in Europe, with Volkswagen taking a significant equity stake in Northvolt’s new German factory. The facility will produce high-performance EV batteries, enhance supply chain reliability, and support Europe’s green transition. The collaboration also includes recycling technologies, sustainable construction practices, and investment in local talent, aligning with Volkswagen’s EUR 30 billion electromobility plan through 2025.

Link to original article

item.title: China: Volvo Cars reorganises operations amid declining sales
item.description:
Volvo Cars is reorganising its business in China and the Asia–Pacific region in response to declining sales and rising competition from domestic automakers. Sales in China fell 8% in the first seven months of 2025. The company has appointed Zhu Ling, former VP at Geely’s Zeekr brand, to lead Asia-Pacific operations, giving local management greater authority to respond to market demands. As part of USD 1.9 billion efficiency program, Volvo plans a global workforce reduction of 7% (around 3,000 jobs), with cuts in China focused on its Shanghai R&D center, aiming to strengthen its regional presence while managing costs.

Link to original article

item.title: China: Xpeng Motors posts 169% sales surge in August 2025, 252% growth year-to-date
item.description:
Xpeng Motors' sales for the month reached 38,000 vehicles, marking a year-on-year increase of 169%. For the first eight months of 2025, Xpeng's cumulative sales were 272,000 vehicles, up by 252% year-on-year.

Link to original article (in Chinese)

item.title: Germany: BMW and Toyota push ahead with next-gen fuel cell tech, targeting 2028 launch
item.description:
BMW is advancing the development of its third-generation fuel cell technology in partnership with Toyota, reaffirming its plan to begin series production by 2028. Unlike many competitors that have scaled back hydrogen initiatives, BMW continues to invest in hydrogen-powered mobility as part of its long-term strategy.

Link to original article (in German)

item.title: China: Dongfeng advances structural lightweighting with world’s largest integrated die-casting plant
item.description:
Dongfeng Motor’s Integrated Die Casting Industrialization Project, the world’s largest in tonnage, has completed acceptance 25 days ahead of schedule. The Wuhan-based factory will feature 16,000-ton and 10,000-ton dual integrated die-casting production lines, enhancing structural lightweighting and manufacturing efficiency for new energy vehicles. The plant, which began construction in November 2024, will produce ultra-large one-piece structural components such as rear floor assemblies and battery housings, with mass production expected by June 2026. This advanced die-casting technology strengthens vehicle bodies while reducing weight, improving both safety and efficiency.

Link to original article (in Chinese)

item.title: Automakers Likely to Scale Back Volume of EVs
item.description:
Automakers in the US are likely to scale back the volume of Electric Vehicles (EVs) to the bare minimum. Many brands, including Tesla, Ford, GM, and Rivian, have already done this. The slowdown in EV production is likely to continue as the automakers try to match pace with the EV sales decline, which is expected to begin in October 2025.

Link to original article

item.title: German automotive suppliers under pressure amid e-mobility transition and weak demand
item.description:
German automotive suppliers such as Bosch, Continental (Conti), and ZF Friedrichshafen are grappling with a slump in orders, job cuts, and the difficult transition to e-mobility. According to automotive expert Constantin Gall from EY, suppliers are particularly affected by lower production volumes, which are only a fraction of what was planned. This is attributed not only to low demand for electric cars but also to the general reluctance of many people to purchase vehicles in the current economic climate. Bosch, the world's largest automotive supplier, is under pressure in many areas, including control units, drives, steering systems, parts for e-cars, and vehicle software. The company has announced savings programs and plans to cut nearly 15,000 jobs worldwide. Continental is spinning off its automotive supply division, which will be listed on the stock exchange as a separate company named Aumovio on September 18, 2025. ZF Friedrichshafen has been in crisis mode for years and expects to report losses again for the current year. Schaeffler is in a comparatively better position due to its diversified business, although it also announced the reduction of 4,700 jobs in Europe. Mahle has cut about 600 jobs in Germany in the past twelve months as it transitions its business towards thermal management for electric vehicles.

Link to original article

item.title: BYD reduces sales target for 2025 by up to 16%
item.description:
Chinese automaker BYD has reduced its sales target for 2025 by up to 16% to 4.6 million vehicles, according to two people familiar with the matter. The latest figure was communicated to select suppliers in August 2025 to help guide planning. In March 2025, BYD informed analysts that it was targeting sales of 5.5 million vehicles for the year. However, in recent months, the number has been downgraded internally several times.

Link to original article

item.title: Germany: Pelzer Swiss Holding’s Happich GmbH acquires BKT GmbH, securing jobs and Braunschweig site
item.description:
BKT GmbH, a German manufacturer of high-precision plastic parts, has been acquired by Happich GmbH, a company of Pelzer Swiss Holding AG. The takeover was approved by creditors' meeting at the end of August 2025 and is retroactively effective from 1st August, 2025. The acquisition ensures the preservation of the Braunschweig location and 43 out of 44 jobs.

Link to original article (in German)

item.title: Germany: Daimler and Bosch partner to accelerate development of next-generation autonomous driving technologies
item.description:
Daimler AG, a German automotive company, has formed a strategic partnership with Bosch to advance the research and development of fully autonomous driving systems. The collaboration combines Daimler’s expertise in vehicle electrification with Bosch’s strengths in sensor technology and software to create autonomous solutions capable of navigating complex urban environments. The initiative aligns with Europe’s growing regulatory frameworks for autonomous vehicles and the global shift toward sustainable mobility. Both companies plan extensive real-world testing to ensure safety and compliance, while also working with regulators to shape future policies. The partnership aims to deliver electric-powered autonomous vehicles that reduce emissions, improve traffic safety, and strengthen their position in the competitive autonomous vehicle market.

Link to original article

item.title: Spain: BEV market witnesses dynamic month in August 2025
item.description:
Spain’s battery electric vehicle (BEV) market saw strong growth in August, 2025, led by Tesla, Kia, and BYD. The Tesla Model 3 topped sales with 1,146 units, marking a 516% year-on-year surge. Kia’s EV3 was sold with 476 units, while the BYD Dolphin Surf followed with 451 units.

Link to original article (in Spanish)

item.title: US: Ford and GM announce strategic partnership to strengthen EV battery supply chain
item.description:
Ford Motor Company and General Motors have announced a strategic partnership to enhance electric vehicle (EV) battery supply chains and accelerate the transition to sustainable automotive technologies. The collaboration aims to boost operational efficiency, drive innovation in battery technology, and support ambitious EV production targets. Plans include joint investments in US based battery production facilities to reduce reliance on foreign suppliers and secure critical materials such as lithium, cobalt, and nickel. By pooling resources, the automakers hope to advance developments in battery management systems, recycling, and fast-charging solutions, while cutting costs and mitigating supply chain risks.

Link to original article

item.title: Europe: Volkswagen, BMW, Renault partner for battery recycling initiatives to boost sustainability
item.description:
Volkswagen, BMW, and Renault have formed a strategic partnership to advance electric vehicle (EV) battery recycling across Europe. The collaboration will focus on developing innovative technologies to recover critical materials such as lithium, cobalt, and nickel from used batteries, creating a circular economy that reduces reliance on primary raw materials. By enhancing lifecycle management of EV components, the initiative aims to cut the carbon footprint of battery production, ensure compliance with strict EU waste and resource regulations, and strengthen the automakers’ competitive edge. The companies will invest in research and development to drive sustainable innovation while aligning with Europe’s broader environmental and regulatory goals.

Link to original article

item.title: US: Kia America's total sales rise 10.4% in August 2025
item.description:
Kia America's total sales increased 10.4% year-on-year to 83,007 units in August 2025. This is the second time that the firm has exceeded 80,000 units in a single month. Year-to-date total sales have increased 8.6%, with retail sales increasing 10.3%.

Link to original article

item.title: Italy: RadiciGroup develops sustainable materials for EVs
item.description:
Italian automotive materials company RadiciGroup has developed a range of sustainable materials for electric vehicles (EVs). The company's Radiflam range of self-extinguishing thermoplastic engineering plastics are based on polyester, polyamide or PPA which is used in motor covers. Renycle is a high-quality, mechanically recycled polyamide construction plastic made from pre- and post-consumer materials. It is used in an automotive sector where environmental sustainability is at the forefront. Furthermore, the company is actively involved in metal replacement, replacing metal components with high-performance plastics to reduce the weight of electric vehicles and increase their range.

Link to original article (in German)

item.title: Germany: Gerhardi Kunststofftechnik acquired by HF Opportunities
item.description:
Gerhardi Kunststofftechnik has been acquired by HF Opportunities, part of the Hannover Finanzgruppe. The purchase agreement was signed on 28th August, 2025. Gerhardi's three locations in Ibbenburen, Rosmart and Ludenscheid will be acquired. Around 960 employees will be retained.

Link to original article (in German)

item.title: China: SNM supplies thermal management products for Xiaomi auto’s EV systems
item.description:
Siquan New Materials (SNM), a Chinese producer and supplier of thermal management products announced on 1st September, 2025, that its products are applied across the automotive industry’s three-electric system such as battery, motor, and electronic control as well as in packaging, onboard electronics, and cabin electronics. The company confirmed it provides thermal management solutions for Xiaomi Auto, supporting the automaker’s electric vehicle development.

Link to original article (in Chinese)

item.title: China: NIO delivers over 72,000 vehicles in Q2/2025
item.description:
NIO delivered more than 72,000 vehicles in the second quarter of 2025, up 26% year-on-year. However, sales volume growth fell to 3% in July 2025. It remains to be seen whether that was a blip or a symptom of a slowing sales growth rate.

Link to original article

item.title: Mexico: Mercedes-Benz likely to maintain production at COMPAS plant
item.description:
Mercedes-Benz is expected to maintain production at its COMPAS plant in Aguascalientes, Mexico, despite the gradual exit of Infiniti from the region. The COMPAS facility, which was opened in 2017 as a joint venture between Nissan and Mercedes-Benz, manufactures Infiniti and Mercedes-Benz models. However, the volume is small compared to its installed capacity, which is designed to produce up to 230,000 vehicles per year. According to the Aguascalientes Government's Secretary of Economic Development, Science and Technology, Esaú Garza de Vega, the company is likely to assign new projects and preserve jobs at the facility.

Link to original article

item.title: Japan/Germany: Mercedes-Benz sells 3.8% stake in Nissan for USD 346 million
item.description:
Mercedes-Benz has announced the sale of its 3.8% stake in Nissan for USD 346 million as part of a portfolio adjustment of the Mercedes Pension Trust. The decision by Mercedes to sell has become a symbol of market distrust of Nissan's recovery strategy, which will have a significant impact on Nissan's future global position.

Link to original article (in Korean)

item.title: Romania: Horse Technologies unveils world’s first mass-produced LPG direct-injection engine
item.description:
Horse Technologies in partnership with Renault and Geely has begun production of a turbocharged 1.2-liter three-cylinder engine, HR12 LPG, which can run on both gasoline and LPG. The new engine uses direct injection technology for the liquified petroleum gas and features a 48-volt mild hybrid system, with a belt-driven starter generator and DC/DC converter. It offers 138 horsepower at 5,500 rpm and 170 pound-feet of torque, available as early as 2,100 rpm. Key innovations include a dedicated direct injection system, an electronic vaporizer, and reinforced components, while the LPG tank is fitted in the spare tire compartment without reducing cabin space.

Link to original article

item.title: Asia: Panasonic Forms Strategic Partnerships with Robotics Companies
item.description:
Panasonic Corporation has formed strategic partnerships with leading robotics firms across Asia to accelerate the adoption of advanced automation in manufacturing. The collaboration will focus on developing collaborative robotics that enable humans and machines to work safely together, particularly in precision-driven industries like automotive and electronics. By integrating robotics with IoT, sensors, and analytics, Panasonic aims to create smart factory solutions that boost productivity, reduce errors, and support real-time decision-making. The initiative also emphasises sustainability, with automation technologies designed to optimise resource use and minimize waste, helping manufacturers in Asia achieve both efficiency and environmental responsibility.

Link to original article

item.title: Mexico: Country advances industrial plan with major investments in automotive, electric mini-vehicles
item.description:
As part of the Mexico Plan announced in January 2025, the government has driven MXN 59.24 billion in investments to establish and modernise production plants in the light motor vehicle industry, alongside MXN 14.90 billion to boost automotive components for export.

Link to original article (in Spanish)

item.title: Europe: Leapmotor to not start B10 production in Spain until Q3/2026
item.description:
Leapmotor will not start production of its B10 electric vehicle in Europe until the third quarter of 2026. Production is planned to be carried out at the Stellantis plant in Zaragoza, Spain. The Zaragoza plant is currently undergoing renovation, according to Chinese media reports, and the company will focus on the B-series of its vehicles in Spain, with production expected to start in the third quarter of 2026.

Link to original article (in German)
